item.description:
Snowshoeing, X/C Ski or Hike

Sunday, Mar., 4th. 2:30 pm.

(PMEC) Brook Road in Amherst, New Hampshire 03031

Host: Steve O. 603-491-1962 0b@tds.net

Can't make it at 2:30 pm. Then call and join us along the way. The Parks & Rec. of Amherst NH. and the Peabody Mill Environmental Center has invited us to join them in their winter activities. So, lets do some snowshoeing, or hiking. You can ski or snowshoe. But, only the snowshoes are for rent at this location. We do an easy 1 to 2 hour hike on the trails. We can even get a guide. If we ask. So, come on out and enjoy the season.

Vicky L. the director wrote: Hello Everyone- We hope you're enjoying the snow as much as we are! Snowshoeing conditions are great and we don't have any reports of blocked trails. Snowshoes are available in a variety of sizes for <30 lbs. to >220 lbs. If you can walk, you can snowshoe! Rent in person during PMEC hours of operation. Monday & Tuesday 9AM-1PM; Friday, Saturday & Sunday 12:00-4:00PM. $6 per resident / $8 per non-resident maximum four hour usage or $10 for 24 hour rental. Don't forget about our School Vacation Day programs for school aged children. Enjoy indoor & outdoor activities such as Hiking, Animal Tracking, Nature Crafts, Songs, Stories, and Games! Friday 12/26, Monday 12/29 – Wednesday 12/31, & Friday 1/2. If you have any questions, please feel free reply to this e-mail or call us at 673-1141 or 673-6248. Register online at www.amherstrec.org. All programs require pre-registration. Thanks, Amherst Recreation Department and PMEC Staff vicky l. 603-801-1623 The Peabody Mill Environmental Center (PMEC) is an environmental and science education center which abuts almost 600 acres of Joe English conservation land. Located at the end of Brook Road in Amherst, New Hampshire, the PMEC is directed by the Amherst Recreation Department. The mission of PMEC is to foster an awareness, understanding and appreciation of the natural world, by offering environmental, conservation, and science programs to all ages. PMEC strives to foster diligent stewardship of our environment so that future generations may inherit and continue to be inspired by the wonders of a protected and natural world. More information on this and other PMEC programs can be found on our website at www.pmec.org or by calling 603-673-1141.

group.name: Trailblazers- A Seacoast Singles Meetup Group
